what: Finnish open government data toolkit for R
title: sorvi tutorial
text: R package provides miscellaneous tools Finnish open government data. contributions, bug reports feedback welcome!

title: sorvi tutorial
text: Installation (Asennus) Finnish provinces (Maakuntatason informaatio) Basic province information (Area, Population, Population Density) Finnish-English province name translations Finnish municipalities (Kuntatason informaatio) Land Survey Finland (Maanmittauslaitos / MML) ID conversion tools Municipality-Postal code conversions (Kunnat vs. postinumerot) Municipality name-ID conversions (Kunnat vs. kuntakoodit) Municipality-province conversions (Kunnat vs. maakunnat) Generic synonyme converter (Synonyymit) Finnish personal identification number (HETU) (Henkilotunnuksen kasittely) See also rOpenGov packages, particular: gisfin Visualization Finnish geographic information helsinki Helsinki open data tools sotkanet THL Sotkanet database health demography pxweb PX-Web interface access data fom Statistics Finland PX-Web compliant sources finpar Finnish parliament data

title: sorvi tutorial
text: assume installed R. use RStudio, change default encoding UTF-8. Linux users also install CURL. Install stable release version R: Development version developers: Test installation loading library: recommend setting UTF-8 encoding: Brief examples package tools provided . examples available Louhos-blog Rmarkdown blog.

title: sorvi tutorial
code: translations <- load_sorvi_data("translation_provinces") print(head(translations)) ##                 English         Finnish ## 1         Åland Islands      Ahvenanmaa ## 2         South Karelia   Etelä-Karjala ## 3 Southern Ostrobothnia Etelä-Pohjanmaa ## 4      Southern Savonia      Etelä-Savo ## 5                Kainuu          Kainuu ## 6       Tavastia Proper      Kanta-Häme

title: sorvi tutorial
text: Finnish municipality information available Statistics Finland (Tilastokeskus; see pxweb package) Land Survey Finland (Maanmittauslaitos). row names data set harmonized can used match data sets different sources, different data sets may carry different versions certain municipality names.

title: sorvi tutorial
text: Source: Maanmittauslaitos, MML. See also gisfin package Finnish GIS data sets.

title: sorvi tutorial
text: Map municipalities correponding provinces Map selected municipalities correponding provinces: Speed conversion predefined info table:
code: m2p <- municipality_to_province()  head(m2p) # Just show the first ones ##           Äänekoski              Ähtäri                Akaa            Alajärvi  ##       "Keski-Suomi"  "EtelÃ¤-Pohjanmaa"         "Pirkanmaa"  "EtelÃ¤-Pohjanmaa"  ##           Alavieska              Alavus  ## "Pohjois-Pohjanmaa"  "EtelÃ¤-Pohjanmaa" municipality_to_province(c("Helsinki", "Tampere", "Turku")) ##          Helsinki           Tampere             Turku  ##         "Uusimaa"       "Pirkanmaa" "Varsinais-Suomi" m2p <- municipality_to_province(c("Helsinki", "Tampere", "Turku"), municipality.info.mml) head(m2p)

title: sorvi tutorial
text: Municipality name code Municipality codes names Complete conversion table
code: convert_municipality_codes(municipalities = c("Turku", "Tampere")) convert_municipality_codes(ids = c(853, 837)) municipality_ids <- convert_municipality_codes() kable(head(municipality_ids)) # just show the first entries

title: sorvi tutorial
text: Generic conversion synonymes harmonized terms. First, get synonyme-name mapping table. example harmonize Finnish municipality names multiple versions. synonyme list can arbitrary.

title: Finnish Open Government Data Toolkit
text: sorvi package originally intended hosting various algorithms Finnish open goverment data R. superseded later rOpenGov packages specialized scope, sorvi now new life hosting various functions helpful rOpenGov package maintenance, authoring preparing presentations. Originally rOpenGov/sorvi fork juusohaapanen/soRvi-dev rOpenGov’s sorvi branch since taken life . fork detached fron juusohaapanen’s branch November 2021.

title: Finnish Open Government Data Toolkit
text: can install development version sorvi GitHub : still CRAN release version sorvi passes CRAN checks without problems contains mostly outdated functions. therefore highly recommended use development version package.

title: Finnish Open Government Data Toolkit
text: Loading package R: Get download statistics eurostat-package, year: Get download statistics various rOpenGov packages time draw chart:  (partly outdated) examples, check tutorial page.
code: library(sorvi) df <- cran_downloads(pkgs = "eurostat", sum = "by_year", use.cache = FALSE) df #> # A tibble: 5 × 3 #> # Groups:   year [5] #>    year package      n #>   <dbl> <fct>    <int> #> 1  2016 eurostat  6419 #> 2  2017 eurostat 12482 #> 3  2018 eurostat 18932 #> 4  2019 eurostat 28454 #> 5  2020 eurostat 31298 packages <- c("eurostat", "giscoR", "sotkanet", "geofi", "sweidnumbr") plot <- cran_downloads(pkgs = packages, sum = "total", output = "plot", use.cache = FALSE) plot

Get CRAN download statistics — cran_downloads
text: Produces tibble visualization package download statistics.

title: Get CRAN download statistics — cran_downloads
code: cran_downloads(   pkgs = "all",   output = "tibble",   sum = "by_month",   plot.scale = 11,   use.cache = TRUE )

title: Get CRAN download statistics — cran_downloads
text: pkgs Package name(s). Default "", prints statistics rOpenGov packages. can also input 1 package names  vector. output "tibble" (default) "plot". sum "by_month" "by_year" "plot" outputs line chart, "total" outputs bar chart. sum "by_month" (default), "by_year" "total" plot.scale integer, default 11. Smaller numbers decrease size plot elements, larger numbers make larger. use.cache Cache downloaded statistics. Default TRUE

title: Get CRAN download statistics — cran_downloads
text: tibble ggplot2 line chart bar chart

title: Get CRAN download statistics — cran_downloads
text: function intended easy retrieval visualization rOpenGov  package download statistics CRAN. evolution R script antagomir. retains features present original R script deemed useful rOpenGov's internal use. function may may useful instances.

title: Municipality Info — get_municipality_info_mml
text: Get information Finnish municipalities Land Survey Finland. (C) Maanmittauslaitos MML 2013.

title: GitHub issues statistics — gh_issue_stats
text: Get statistics GitHub issues GitHub API.

title: GitHub issues statistics — gh_issue_stats
code: gh_issue_stats(   owner = "ropengov",   repo = "geofi",   issue.type = NA,   time.from = NA,   time.to = NA )

title: GitHub issues statistics — gh_issue_stats
text: owner Repository owner / organization. Default "ropengov" repo Repository name. Default "geofi" issue.type Type issues printed: "issue", "PR" NA printing  (default). time.Start date ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ. Default "2010-09-01T00:00:00Z". time.End date ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ. Default Sys.time().

title: GitHub issues statistics — gh_issue_stats
text: function intended easy information retrieval rOpenGov  package issues pull requests. specifically, function returns tibble containing information issue id, title, status (open closed), number comments, opened , created, openers status (rOpenGov organization member, package contributor regular user  opened e.g. bug issue) type issue. GitHub Issues API handles Pull Requests Issues similarly therefore  function returns types default. Different types issues  can filtered using issue.type parameter. Kudos function go Jennifer Bryan. changes made mostly related adding additional fields (opener_type, issue_type) output tibble writing function around original contributions. scope function mainly help rOpenGov team analyze type user feedback get via GitHub issues therefore scope function limited.

title: GitHub issues statistics — gh_issue_stats
text: Original scripts Jennifer Bryan (jennybc), function Pyry Kantanen <pyry.kantanen@gmail.com>
